description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6mpbm","text":"After genomic DNA (gDNA) has been isolated and quantified, it can be used for many downstream applications. While we will use our genomic DNA samples for whole genome sequencing using Nanopore sequencing technology, we can also use the gDNA to amplify one gene for Sanger sequencing. These different sequencing methods contrast one another: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cins1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbkdb","text":"Table. Comparison of Nanopore and Sanger DNA Sequencing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hm7b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3daqq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ot6c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35h1r","text":"PCR amplification of 16S","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lbl","text":"We will amplify the bacterial 16S gene, which encodes a subunit of ribosomes. Biologists use this gene to compare evolutionary relationships by sequence similarities and differences to organize biological taxonomies. Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) enables scientists to amplify many copies of a gene, and we will target 16S for amplification. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":98,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":98,"length":42}],"data":{}},{"key":"85lot","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":""},"colTitles":[],"colWidths":[],"data":[["Nanopore Sequencing","Sanger Sequencing"],["High Throughput (many genes at once)","Low Throughput (one gene at a time)"],["Sequences gDNA directly","Sequences PCR amplified DNA"],["Ion current base calling","Fluorophore base calling"]],"guid":"7951B7470BE2473B98C73332ADA7DFBF","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":[],"printData":[["Nanopore Sequencing","Sanger Sequencing"],["High Throughput (many genes at once)","Low Throughput (one gene at a time)"],["Sequences gDNA directly","Sequences PCR amplified DNA"],["Ion current base calling","Fluorophore base calling"]],"rowHeights":[]}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":""},"colTitles":[],"colWidths":[],"data":[["Nanopore Sequencing","Sanger Sequencing"],["High Throughput (many genes at once)","Low Throughput (one gene at a time)"],["Sequences gDNA directly","Sequences PCR amplified DNA"],["Ion current base calling","Fluorophore base calling"]],"guid":"7951B7470BE2473B98C73332ADA7DFBF","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":[],"printData":[["Nanopore Sequencing","Sanger Sequencing"],["High Throughput (many genes at once)","Low Throughput (one gene at a time)"],["Sequences gDNA directly","Sequences PCR amplified DNA"],["Ion current base calling","Fluorophore base calling"]],"rowHeights":[],"url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-019-13036-1"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5i41r","text":"To remove the reagents from the PCR and isolate pure DNA for Sanger sequencing, we need to \"clean up\" our amplified DNA samples. In BIT 295, we use reagents from the   Kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":166,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e7kml","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9c9gd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"4104A9B4341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"QIAquick PCR Purification Kit","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"28104","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/shop/sample-technologies/dna-sample-technologies/dna-cleanup/qiaquick-pcr-purification-kit","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/products/","name":"Qiagen"}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"78lhd","text":"Add all   of the PCR reaction to five volumes ( ) PB buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":47,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2okma","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"250","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dckms","text":"Add 750 µL PE to wash the column. Incubate at RT for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"886d","text":"Remove the spin column from the collection tube and add to a new wash tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7lkju","text":"Remove the spin column from the collection tube and add itto a new collection tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7qo9","text":"Add   EB to elute. Incubate at RT for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ft00","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bmbr1","text":"Quantify 2 µl using the Implen that has been blanked with the elution buffer (EB).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dk77q","text":"DNA can be stored at   or on ice while being used and should be stored long-term at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":84,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9g4a1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0m10","text":"For Sanger sequencing, start by sending out   of ~100 ng/µL DNA of your LONG amplicon for three sequencing reactions with all three primers 27fwd, 515 fwd, and 1492rev. Prepare   a 1:10 dilution of your 100 µM primers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":44,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":44,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":177,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"croft","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eum52","text":"If you do not get clear chromatograms to interpret the sequence, next send out your SHORT amplicon for Sanger sequencing with only primers 515fwd and 1992rev. Prepare 10µL a 1:10 dilution of your 100 µM primers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6j9ej","text":"16S rRNA Sequencing: A PCR-based Technique to Identify Bacterial Species","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":72}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":72}],"data":{}},{"key":"3c627","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4d5r","text":"Adapted from: Identification of unknown bacterial isolates using Sanger sequencing of the 16S rRNA gene | CHMI services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":14,"length":105}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":14,"length":105}],"data":{}},{"key":"ajl6a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3stdf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5A23B1F2D69611EEB9800A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.jove.com/v/10510/16s-rrna-sequencing-pcr-based-technique-to-identify-bacterial"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5A23B1F2D69611EEB9800A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://chmi-sops.github.io/mydoc_16S_Sanger.html"}}}}
